column1: It’s up to each of us how we celebrate Thanksgiving. Please be responsible. We'd all like to gather w/ lots of family & friends but COVID is real. Do your part to spread love & cheer not COVID. Be safe vigilant & help protect others so we can all celebrate together in 2021!

This week we give thanks & I'm thankful for all of you. 2020 has been challenging to say the least. But I’m grateful to be part of a caring (socially distant) community; to represent RI; & for friends family & #frontlineworkers. What are you thankful for this #Thanksgiving?

Ascertainment was step one. Now Senate Republican leaders must take step two and allow a COVID-relief bill to come to the floor so Congress can swiftly pass a bill to protect public health & people’s economic well-being.
I know folks are excited. But please keep celebrations #COVIDsafe & socially distanced. Change is coming to the White House but the virus is still rampant & we must protect #publichealth.

1000 #COVID deaths yesterday isn’t “almost nothing.” It’s tragic. Heartbreaking. Unacceptable. Instead of downplaying the rising death toll we must confront it.  Getting this virus under control requires caring thoughtful honest leadership & unity. https://t.co/fj2xlC4gFR

Looking for a new #COVIDsafe adult #Halloween tradition this year? Please consider donating blood to @RIBloodCenter. It’s not spooky but it could help save a life. Unfortunately there is a critical blood shortage in RI right now. Be a hero this Halloween & #donateblood.

Amidst the hardship of #COVID it’s heartwarming to see people doing their part to protect the health & safety of others. This virus has reshaped many things but it hasn’t changed our shared values or the basic goodness of people. Thanks to all those making a difference!

COVID is keeping us apart but the only way to effectively combat it is by working together. We must each do our part. Please #WearAMask. Please take proper #COVID precautions. I know #COVIDFatigue is real but the virus is spreading & we all need to step up to help save lives.

Instead of passing #COVIDrelief Senate Republicans rushed to the WH to clink #SCOTUS champagne flutes & then skipped town. But not before scheduling the 1st vote of the #lameduck session on… wait for it… a judicial nominee. Americans deserve better. https://t.co/YnprtDs0QY

When a #COVIDvaccine is ruled scientifically safe it should be FREE for all Americans. Trump Admin initially was going to let #redtape force some seniors to pay. I intro'ed the Ensuring Access to COVID-19 Vaccines for Seniors Act (S. 4825). Now Trump Admin is reversing course.

The U.S. Senate must help combat #COVID; deliver relief for struggling families biz & communities; & turn our economy around. Instead GOP leaders chose a lifetime job for 1 extreme #SCOTUS nom. over #publichealth the health of our economy & the needs of hardworking Americans. https://t.co/eImNNwYp81

Outrageous. After 5 months of inaction Sen. McConnell scheduled a #showvote on a cynical ‘skinny’ #COVIDrelief bill that is completely inadequate. The American people deserve solutions not stunts & backroom double-dealing. https://t.co/pSDerWKb2P

REMINDER: #Facemasks work. They are an effective tool for preventing the spread of #COVID infections. Thanks to all the hardworking men & women who wear a mask to protect themselves their families & the community. Please be vigilant. #MaskUpRI https://t.co/EneZrM77V7

Families small businesses & jobless Americans are struggling to pay bills. Instead of providing them robust relief Pres Trump is thrashing around trying to provide himself political cover. He can’t even agree w/ GOP leaders & is not serious about a #COVIDrelief bill.

RI is leading when it comes to coordinating a communitywide response to combat #COVID. Today I toured the state’s education operations center (#EDOC) & met w/ @RINationalGuard @RIHEALTH @RIDeptEd to get a firsthand look at school safety initiatives. https://t.co/FWJIrbSqvE

It didn’t have to be this way. Pres Trump’s inept handling of #COVID & Congressional Republicans’ refusal to extend #unemploymentinsurance to job seekers made things worse deepening & extending recession. https://t.co/t8oHMzfDRp

If #POTUS can get #COVID then anyone can. COVID is still rampant. Other nations have effectively contained it the U.S. has not. We're lagging due to lack of presidential leadership. Willful ignorance is not a strategy it's a dangerous Rx for more infection & prolonged crisis.

Saving lives means investing in training & infrastructure long before disaster hits. Visited @RhodeIslandEMA HQ in Cranston today to offer thanks to Dir. Marc Pappas & his amazing team for working around the clock to safeguard RI from COVID & other public safety hazards & threats https://t.co/Lg5qAUrNyo

Senate Republicans are rushing the process to install an extremist #SCOTUS Justice but they are in no rush whatsoever to help families & communities who’ve been hit hardest by Trump Admin’s mismanagement of #COVID.

Dark days ahead if Senate GOP & Trump Admin continue blocking comprehensive bipartisan #COVIDrelief. New @wapo story exposes rising rate of unpaid utility bills & threat it poses. That’s why I’m working to boost #LIHEAP & create a #HousingAssistanceFund. https://t.co/Ox2bJ5CqzZ

As we work to contain #COVID we must also stop the spread of #disinformation that threatens public health. Intro'ed new bill w/ @maziehirono & colleagues to provide $1 million booster shot to help immunize American public from false & misleading info & trace the spread.

Congress must swiftly investigate Trump Admin’s misuse of $300M in #CDC funds that could have gone to helping #COVID patients & developing a vaccine but was instead diverted to a wasteful self-promoting propaganda campaign. https://t.co/wp73XMBygR

Trump Admin must stop downplaying contagiousness of #COVID & trying to suppress facts. Arm people with accurate info & they can make smart choices. Suppressing scientific findings like this to try to boost Trump’s electoral chances is sick & wrong. https://t.co/mo6mpGgqRv

Pres Trump now claims CDC Dir. Robert Redfield was 'confused' when he answered my question about #COVID & #facemask efficacy. Both the science & the answer are clear. Instead of pressuring doctors Pres Trump should encourage people to wear masks in public https://t.co/xUFV2Dq9rc

Like states our cities & towns need help to fight the pandemic. That’s why we pushed for this community block grant money for RI.  $7.6 million in #CDBG is now on its way to help communities combat COVID & support their economic priorities. https://t.co/v0w4Gxn9Ld

After months of inaction the GOP's #COVID bill failed because it was an inadequate negligent package that would leave millions in the lurch. We need to pass a bill that protects hospitals nursing homes frontline workers & communities hit hardest by the virus...now.

Congressional Republicans took a break from their work responding to #COVID but the virus didn’t take a pause. Thousands are dying & millions have contracted COVID. Americans deserve more than a partisan show vote -- they need a comprehensive response & overdue assistance.
Hope you have a safe enjoyable #LaborDay. Today is a great day to support local businesses & honor workers who are on the job by wearing a mask & maintaining a safe social distance.

Visited @QuonsetRI today to see how two RI commercial dive companies are putting their ingenuity to work saving lives of #COVID patients & keeping front line #healtcareworkers safe. Pleased @US_FDA issued EUAs for Subsalve USA & Lombardi Undersea’s new #OxygenTreatmentHood. https://t.co/HMkZhFmWA0

Safe effective vaccines help prevent disease & protect public health. Transparency is key to boosting trust & ensuring public confidence. The #FDA must be forthcoming about its deliberations over whether to approve any new #COVIDvaccine. https://t.co/PwGM8oLsSH

COVID-19 has transformed how we live work & grieve. But it hasn’t changed who we are or limited our capacity to care for one another. All of us have reason to hope & remain vigilant. Brighter days lay ahead. But today we pause to reflect on those we’ve lost & honor their lives.

Each of us must ask: How can we do a better job going forward to prevent the loss of more lives? We are each other’s keepers. It is up to every single one of us to do our part (#WearAMask #SocialDistance etc) to keep ourselves & each other healthy & safe.

We pause & reflect on the toll this pandemic has taken & grieve those gone too soon. 1000+ RI lives lost to COVID19: a staggering immeasurable loss of neighbors friends & family. We mourn every one of them & our hearts ache for those they left behind. https://t.co/8Sr5v1jOnq

The health of American people & U.S. economy must come first. Instead of forcing #unemployment aid to lapse while Republicans fight among themselves Senate GOP should join Dems in extending #UI to save people & businesses as COVID cases are surging.  https://t.co/E2MSXJn3Uo

Don't give up America! We are so much better & more capable than this. #COVID19 is a mindless virus. We can combat it by being smart considerate & taking proper precautions. If Pres Trump doesn't want to unify & lead that's his problem. But the U.S. can & will overcome COVID.

Health workers need #PPE to protect themselves & prevent spread of infection. With #COVID19 spiking nationwide we're seeing signs of another #PPEshortage. Trump Admin needs to fully use the #DPA to ensure health workers & patients have needed supplies & protective gear. #PPENow https://t.co/CBEtSiqsgz

We need effective strategies to protect #renters #homeowners & those experiencing #homelessness during #COVID19 pandemic. And we need smart targeted #housing investments & policies to help save people neighborhoods & communities. Join the conversation: https://t.co/uX7NCCoiRS

As #COVID19 cases spike in states around U.S. the Trump Admin must extend the #PublicHealthEmergency declaration or it will expire on July 25. I urge Trump Admin to act now to ensure #telehealth #telementalhealth & other #CARESAct measures & reforms can continue beyond 7/25.

Additional state & local aid is absolutely critical to preventing a deeper recession & shortening #COVID19 crisis. People states & communities are reeling & need federal help to improve health & reopen the right way: with proven strategies for testing tracing & quarantine.

People can’t work if they’re sick. They can’t work if schools & daycare are closed. Many Republicans want to use the June jobs snapshot as an excuse for inaction. But COVID-cases are skyrocketing now. The longer GOP delays the harder it will be for schools to safely reopen.

America’s economic stability & success depend on getting #COVID19 under control. U.S. needs an evidence-based approach to improving #publichealth. That means more federal $$$ to help schools businesses hospitals communities & states plan & execute effective strategies.

ATTN RI Small Biz: New law extending the deadline for #smallbiz to apply for aid under the #PaycheckProtectionProgram (#PPP) was just signed. This means businesses struggling w/ #COVID19 impact now have until Aug. 8 to apply for fully forgivable loans. https://t.co/he29iWXTyg

Libraries are essential community resources providing tech & broadband access support to remote learners teleworkers & jobseekers & critical info & connections. I’m introing Library Stabilization Fund to provide $2B to help them weather COVID & keep offering critical services. https://t.co/PQm2zm9zyh

Pres Trump’s short-sighted political pressure to reopen before a national strategy of testing tracing & quarantine were firmly in place has cost U.S. dearly. His failure of leadership helped cause a spike in #COVID19 cases hospitalizations & set back health of our economy.

Masks help protect you & those around you. When you go to a store or confined public area please wear a mask. And please don't give workers & business owners a hard time for trying to protect their customers. Preventing #COVID19 is everybody's business! #MaskUpRI #StopTheSpread https://t.co/ax0ZQhoJTy

Today RI starts #Phase3 of reopening. Restrictions are lifting but serious risks remain. Please don’t let your #COVID19 guard down! The progress we’ve made is reversible if we don’t all do our part. Make healthy choices for yourself & others to help keep RI moving forward.

If Trump-backed #ACArepeal lawsuit succeeds millions of sick people will end up in emergency rooms with nowhere else to go & no way to pay & it will cost taxpayers far more in the long run. People w/ #COVID19 could be left #uninsurable. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/Tx6wOgT2Er

Trump Admin’s plan to strip #healthcare from millions of Americans in the midst of a #pandemic is legislative malpractice. If Trump 'wins' Americans lose potentially leaving #COVID19 survivors uninsurable & our economy in tatters. We must #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/71Tsgi73lj

Today we intro'd the bipartisan #CORPSAct to mobilize the power of national service assist communities in need & put more Americans to work combating the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) and building a better future while also making higher education more accessible & affordable. https://t.co/ioAxE7UOkV

Those living pay check to paycheck are hit hardest by #COVID19 & this public health crisis can become a housing disaster. I delivered another $6.2M in federal ESG funding for RI to help non-profits local gov’t w/ housing & #homelessness.  https://t.co/zp5NORqNSQ

The reason U.S. #unemployment is as high as it is today (twice as high as EU unemployment rate) is because Pres Trump failed to take #COVID19 threat seriously & instead treated it like a stock market issue. Too many Americans are still out of work. We can & must do better.

It’s the first of the month & the rent is due but millions of Americans impacted by #COVID19 are struggling to pay through no fault of their own. Congress should support #RentReliefNow to prevent this public health crisis from becoming an #affordablehousing disaster.

The weeks ahead are crucial in our fight against #COVID19 & a healthy dose of kindness compassion & civic responsibility can help #StopTheSpread. When you do your best to stay healthy & keep others safe it has an exponential benefit for the health & well-being of all. #BeKind

Test. Test. Test. Keeping #COVID19 contained & under control means we need effective testing. While Trump Admin still doesn’t have a comprehensive testing strategy RI continues to do its part. More local sites opening today w/ help from @CVSHealth. https://t.co/akMQknc1oC

Even before #COVID19 outbreak the Trump Admin shortchanged seniors citizens & put #OlderAmericans health at risk w/ misplaced budget priorities. Ex: Trump’s FY 2021 budget called for $750 billion in cuts to #Medicare & $844 billion in cuts to #Medicaid over next decade.

Seniors & people with underlying health conditions are at heightened risk from #COVID19 & Congress must take action to ensure their health & safety. We need policy changes & additional $$$ to protect the physical mental & economic health of those most vulnerable to #COVID19.
Thanks to Agnes Keeney for putting her skills to work helping others & combating coronavirus! #RhodyResilient #ActsofKindness #KindnessMatters https://t.co/eJqd5Vp3BC

RIers have done an incredible job of #flatteningthecurve. Let’s keep it flat! Please remember #COVID19 is still out here & we must all do our part to keep ourselves & others from getting sick. Stay safe & healthy as you enjoy your weekend & let’s keep positive trends going.

Congressional Republicans blocking state & local aid & holding up #unemploymentinsurance are ignoring basic economics & epidemiology. #COVID19 doesn't care about elections ideology or fiscal quarters. COVID-19 remains a serious threat & U.S. gov't needs a comprehensive response
Heartbreaking that we’re losing so many WWII veterans to #COVID19. We must all do our part to help keep others safe. #StopTheSpread #GreatestGeneration https://t.co/NFmE4Osuud

The #COVID19 pandemic is hitting different states at different times. But every state is facing higher costs & lower revenues. To rescue the U.S. economy the federal gov't must act in the best interest of ALL states & provide more resources & flexibility. https://t.co/1mZjzMKbgM

It’s up to each of us to help America respond recover & rebuild. We introduced the Pandemic Response & Opportunity Through #NationalService Act to put more Americans to work combating #COVID19. Together we will build a better future. #Stand4Service https://t.co/gg9Ai97Z73

Coronavirus is hitting Latino communities especially hard. I want to ensure everyone has access to health care & the support they need to safely get through this. We are all in this together & there’s only one way to overcome #COVID19: JUNTOS! https://t.co/ckGn6DHKgf

The nation’s #coronavirus death toll has surpassed 58500 people including over 240 RIers. These aren’t just numbers they’re people who were taken from us too soon. We miss mourn & memorialize them -- not for how they died but for the lives they lived https://t.co/7EvRIriZur

Trump Admin made it harder for people to automatically get their #COVID19 emergency relief payments but I don’t want anyone to miss out. IRS has launched a new non-filers tool for VA & SSI recipients w/ a qualifying child & set May 5 deadline. Learn more: https://t.co/6HqFyD6QX3

Thank you for following #SaferAtHome guidelines to help save lives. I know #QuarantineFatigue is setting in but now is not time to relent. #COVID19 can be a killer. The threat is serious & we must take an evidenced-based approach to reopening RI. Be safe be wise & be strong!

As Pres Trump feuds w/ governors & seeks to limit their ability to spend #COVID19 relief funds @SenateDems are WAITING FOR REPUBLICANS TO STEP UP for THEIR STATES & GET the Trump Admin to remove needless restrictions. Read our letter: https://t.co/9hxKODuKUb

At EVERY STEP of #COVID19 response so far GOP leaders have badly underestimated misjudged & delayed needed aid for the American people. Now they're at it again: refusing to help states & communities on front lines of pandemic. That's a real setback for the entire U.S. economy.

Dems are trying to save lives & livelihoods from #COVID19 but Sen. GOP sees pandemic as opportunity to force states into bankruptcy & slash state & local services. This partisan ploy is a needless drag on US economy & threatens finances of every tax payer https://t.co/K0J61SrFeZ

Federal loan programs like #PPP were supposed to be lifeline for small businesses. But many minority-owned businesses were boxed out from accessing aid. This new COVID3.5 bill will help ensure needed assistance & economic recovery reaches more #smallbiz & communities. https://t.co/COBkuvzrzW

Coronavirus has stolen so much from us: opportunities loved ones & even our ability to grieve together. We’ve already lost over 37000 Americans to #COVID19 including 137 RIers & we deeply mourn them all. We may be apart but all of our hearts are w/ those who are suffering.

GOOD NEWS RI: U.S. Treasury wired $625 Million in state stabilization funds to RI through the #CoronavirusReliefFund that I included in #CARESAct. This $$$ will provide a big financial boost to RI & I'll continue pressing to ensure states can spend it on areas of greatest need.

RI's @AGNeronha is leading efforts to stop scammers. If you see a #COVID19scam or think you have been the victim of a scam you may contact the AG’s Consumer Protection Unit at: (401) 274-4400 or e mail: consumers@riag.ri.gov

HELP STOP COVID-19 SCAMMERS: If anyone calls or texts you claiming to the be the IRS and asks for your personal information regarding your #coronavirus direct payment or rebate check do NOT reply. They are NOT legit.

We need both public & private solutions to help effectively combat #COVID19 support #smallbiz & help communities. Thanks to @GoldmanSachs for deploying $10 Million in emergency loans to RI small businesses.

Red & blue states alike are pleading for additional federal help. Congress & Trump Admin must listen & act. The #CARESAct was well-intentioned but didn't do enough. Congressional Rs must start listening to states who are on the front lines of #COVID19. https://t.co/HBfXCehVCv

There are many unsung heroes of #COVID19Crisis & all of them deserve to be fairly compensated for working hard at a time of elevated health risk. I'm pushing for #HeroesFund #hazardpay increase for #frontline workers who’ve been on the job thru-out crisis. https://t.co/SFGch5Vkle

RI is facing a state of emergency & these funds will provide a significant boost. Every state is grappling w/ ⬆️ costs & ⬇️revenue while shouldering responsibility of combating  #COVID19. This $ will help states & communities effectively respond now & withstand financial trauma.

UPDATE: After political theater on Senate floor today I’m pleased to report that real bipartisan discussions have now begun on next round of Emergency #Coronavirus funding. We need to fix & enhance #PPP & take comprehensive approach to helping #smallbiz hospitals & states.

Congress must work together to get money into the hands of those bearing the brunt of #COVID19 pandemic. We must provide bipartisan remedies to promote public health & protect the economic well-being of people communities & Main Street businesses. We’re all in this together!

Nobody wants to hear this but we're still in the early stages of the battle vs. #COVID19. We can get it under control. But to stop it from returning we can't allow our defenses to crumble. We must invest more in testing hospitals & health workers #PPE research & vaccine.

Hospitals health centers & primary care practices are cornerstones of our communities & public health. If they collapse under the strain of #COVID19 everyone suffers. Congress must work together to bolster our health system to keep people & the economy healthy.

Hospitals are on the front lines of #COVID19 pandemic & Sen. McConnell knows they need more help. The #CARESAct included $100B for hospitals & health centers but now the Trump Admin seems to be trying to divert hospital funds to pay for other things. https://t.co/n2U3VAqOy8

Pres Trump’s lack of coordination & failure to fully utilize #DPA in midst of #COVID19 pandemic means states bid against each other for scarce medical equipment & #PPE driving up costs for all & making it harder for states w/ most urgent need to access life-saving gear. #PPENow

Just spoke w/ my colleagues in delegation & @SEIU1199_NE workers & caregivers who are on the frontlines of #COVID19 crisis. We are truly grateful for their service & committed to prioritizing their health & safety as they care for others. We must ensure they have #PPENow.

I’ve been informed RI’s request for @NationalGuard forces in RI under #Title32 has been approved. I salute the outstanding men & women of @RINationalGuard who are working non-stop to combat #COVID19 & I will continue pressing to ensure they get additional support from fed gov't.

@TheDishRIM @davidcicilline @JimLangevin Trump Admin still has to finalize rules. But short answer: Yes smallbiz that laid off staff due to COVID19 may access #CARESAct forgivable loans *IF* they restore full-time employment & salary levels. Treasury guidelines should be issued soon w/ dates etc.

RI’s #coronavirus disaster declaration has been officially granted paving way for additional federal help to bolster RI’s emergency protective measures. This is something the Congressional delegation has been advocating for weeks. Glad Trump Admin granted request. #COVID19

CNN: "A Rhode Island police officer just reminded the world that while the coronavirus pandemic can claim lives shut down cities and change life as we know it it can't take away kindness..." https://t.co/ret8lhlQUU

@jameschuffy There are so many great non-profits in RI worthy of support. And on nat’l level @FEMA’s list of vetted non-profits supporting #COVID19 response efforts are available from @NationalVOAD: https://t.co/nBfNdmMgBZ

RIers are stepping up to donate personal protective equipment (#PPE) for medical staff treating coronavirus patients. Now we need the the White House to step up too & start delivering more life-saving assistance to those on the front lines of this #COVID19 pandemic. #PPEshortage

I hope RIers continue acts of grace & kindness throughout #COVID19 crisis. We’ll need that spirit going forward. For those looking to help: contributing to non-profits of your choice is best & please continue supporting local biz (in compliance w/ #socialdistance guidelines).

Dear RIers: THANK YOU for being incredible! Even in these uncertain times you inspire & amaze me. Stay strong hunker down & let’s all do our part to help keep others healthy. The road ahead is difficult but we're on this journey together (at a safe #socialdistance). #401Love
From $1200 direct payments to enhanced unemployment to $500 per child learn what the new coronavirus economic stabilization law means for you your family & for RI:  https://t.co/n1Lh6b1hSP

It took a lot of hard work & team work but Democrats successfully turned a corporate bailout proposal into a landmark #PeopleFirst emergency rescue bill that will help combat #COVID19 & support the health & well-being of all Americans. #ForThePeople #CARESAct

Full U.S. Senate about to pass $2.2T Emergency #Coronavirus Economic Rescue bill. This landmark legislation provides federal funds to help individuals hospitals communities & small businesses hit hardest by #COVID19 & includes stronger oversight & accountability structure.

In midst of #COVID19 pandemic & economic fallout businesses should carefully review the Emergency #Coronavirus Economic Rescue package before making any decisions about layoffs. This bill offers lots of assistance options & benefits for companies that help protect workers.

We are in the midst of a mushrooming crisis that requires an immediate and massive federal response. I was able to include a $150B State Stabilization Fund in the Emergency #Coronavirus Economic Rescue Agreement that will direct $1.25 billion in economic help for Rhode Island.

State gov’ts are working OT to combat #coronavirus & help people. As a result they're now facing fiscal cliffs. There should be bipartisan support for #StateStabilizationFund to ensure states can meet their financial obligations as they care for people & battle this pandemic.

A quick history of why Emergency Coronavirus Relief package is delayed & where we’re at:  - Bipartisan Taskforce works on bill - McConnell scraps bipartisan work & adds $500B slush fund - Dems say no way - Bipartisan talks resume progress - McConnell show votes slow things down

Shouldn’t Republicans want to help food banks mental health clinics community-based nursing homes rape crisis centers & other nonprofits as part of #coronavirus response? Shockingly GOP doing just the opposite. Remove partisan riders & #PutPeopleFirst https://t.co/ITrA5QEbv9

We're making progress on an emergency #coronavirus rescue plan. But show votes on McConnell’s $500B slushfund only slows things down. Dems are committed to helping all hardworking Americans protecting taxpayers delivering $ for states & hospitals & saving our economy.

Testing testing testing. The Trump Admin’s epic failure to secure & deploy #coronavirus testing kits continues to hinder response & containment. Everyone should have access to testing & every hospital should be granted access to #PPE. We must speed assistance to those in need.

The nat'l shortage of personal protective equipment (PPE) is making #COVID19 pandemic worse. Our doctors nurses & first responders can't effectively save lives if they can’t protect their own health & get sick. If you have extra supplies please consider donating. #GetMePPE

The economic fallout from #COVID19 is hitting working families the hardest. #LIHEAP is a lifeline for millions & we must provide additional funding. No one should have to choose between paying their energy bills and affording food & medicine especially not now.

Suspending federal student loan repayments is a start. But the federal gov’t should be doing more to ease the financial burden caused by the #coronavirus pandemic. Instead of just suspending repayments we should be reducing what students owe & lowering rates.

There are now 54 identified #COVID19 cases in RI. Gov. Raimondo has activated the RI National Guard to assist in the response. I am working to ensure the federal gov’t covers National Guard costs for RI & every state that needs them.

Testing testing testing. America needs better #coronavirus testing. Trump Admin’s failure to plan & deploy testing kits is hindering effective response. Trump Admin must be held accountable for its failure to improve America’s #COVID19 testing capacity. https://t.co/n9eMj9AFbz

5 days after the House voted 363-40 to approve the #FamiliesFirstCoronavirusResponseAct the Senate finally just voted 90-8 to approve the measure providing: free testing paid emergency leave for workers expanded unemployment insurance & more for those impacted by #coronavirus

I support invoking the Defense Powers Act. It's a needed step to ramp up domestic production of life-saving medical supplies. Pres Trump should have already taken this step & must accelerate a comprehensive whole-of-government approach to combating #coronavirus.

For the last 5 days Congressional Republicans needlessly delayed crucial assistance to help with #coronavirus testing paid sick leave expanded unemployment insurance & more. We must speed additional aid to people in need! https://t.co/F7ngwqwuvp

SECDEF Esper called to inform me the Pentagon will provide federal health officials w/ respirator masks & ventilators to help combat #COVID19 pandemic. This is a good step & more action is needed. DoD must support FEMA & HHS & redirect $ from border wall to combat #cornavirus.

I was just informed that @SBAgov has granted the state's disaster declaration request & is opening financial relief to help #smallbiz owners weathering the economic impacts of #COVID19. Interested business owners can learn more & apply online: https://t.co/igpdEULCPD

More federal assistance for workers impacted by #coronavirus will be coming. Kudos to @tednesi & @TimWhiteRI for this helpful overview of programs designed to help RIers who are currently out of work due to #COVID19: https://t.co/ToGAoCtIiP

I'm working to pass a bipartisan emergency #coronavirus economic relief bill to provide tens of billions of dollars for: - free coronavirus testing - paid sick leave with help for businesses - emergency unemployment insurance - expanded food aid - & more to come.

20th #coronavirus case in RI has been confirmed. 500 RIers now in self-quarantine. Those numbers are likely to rise - as expected - as more effective testing ramps up. Good news: RIer w/ first confirmed #COVID19 case has been discharged from hospital. We will get through this!

The President declared a national emergency. The House acted and now it is the Senate's turn. I urge GOP Leader McConnell to call an emergency vote on the bipartisan #FamiliesFirstCoronavirusResponseAct. Don't needlessly delay aid to Americans battling the spread of #COVID19.

Schools are closing & more workers staying home to mitigate the spread of #COVID19. To help people get through this we need emergency paid leave UI benefits & funds for the hardest hit. Emergency declaration is a start but GOP must support emergency stimulus that helps workers

We have a shared responsibility to mitigate the spread of #coronavirus. I urge you to exercise common sense & caution. There will be disruptions to everyone’s lives in the coming weeks. But health & safety come first. We’re in it for the long haul & we’ll get through it together.

For our health & our economy’s health we need a major emergency #coronavirus economic stimulus package w/ targeted assistance for workers & businesses affected by #COVID19 outbreak. It should include #paidsickleave enhanced unemployment insurance & more. https://t.co/HGgFPTqNeL

I support RI’s #coronavirus state of emergency declaration. It is a needed proactive step to help ensure RI can expedite the purchasing of medical equipment. This declaration will also enable RI to access federal assistance to further prepare the state’s health care system.

Pres Trump must stop spreading false and misleading information about the status of #coronavirus outbreak. We need test kits not falsehoods. Inexcusable that U.S. has only done about 2000 coronavirus tests so far while South Korea alone has already conducted over 140000.

There is still time to contain the spread of #coronavirus but it requires a smart coordinated response that follows the advice of public health experts & scientists. This $8B Emergency Approps package is a necessary down payment to combat the virus. https://t.co/JrwJcyChzi

This emergency appropriations bill will help protect the health and safety of Americans & ensure RI has strong federal support to respond to the #coronavirus crisis. This is a smart down payment & should be swiftly & overwhelmingly approved. #COVID19 https://t.co/OJgqptTjQk

The #coronavirus is a major threat to public health & the health of our economy. The bipartisan emergency appropriations package must help #smallbusinesses cope with possible disruption. #SBA already has protocols in place & we must ensure resources are there to help #smallbiz.

Communication collaboration cooperation & transparency are key to stopping the spread of #coronavirus. I will do everything I can to ensure RI has strong federal support to effectively respond & keep people safe. We're all in this together. #COVID19 https://t.co/oDmcCMgg7y

I’m disturbed by reports the White House is muzzling Dr. Fauci a top @NIAIDNews disease expert. This is a time for expertise and real information. The Trump Admin should allow experts to speak out speak for science & a plan that will help protect the American people. #COVID19
